heroDescription: Manassas, Virginia, is a historic city with a vibrant community and growing economy.
landscapeDescription: Manassas has a population of 41,705 and is experiencing steady economic growth, driven by its proximity to Washington D.C. and diverse industries.
uniqueNeeds: Manassas requires tailored financial services to support its diverse population and growing industries.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Manassas faces risks from its retail and healthcare concentration; housing market volatility and flooding risks are concerns. Diversify investments to mitigate economic shocks.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Manassas has shown a 3% annual growth rate, driven by retail and healthcare expansion.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Manassas is $85,000, reflecting a diverse economic base.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Manassas are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and investment diversification.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), the cost of living in Manassas is 10% higher than the national average, driven by housing and transportation costs.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the real estate market in Manassas is competitive, with home prices rising 5% year-over-year.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Manassas is fostering a supportive business climate, attracting new startups and expanding existing businesses.
